scada.overview:
**SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition)** üè≠

SCADA systems monitor and control industrial processes. They use protocols like Modbus to communicate with field devices.

**Key Components:**
‚Ä¢ HMI (Human-Machine Interface)
‚Ä¢ RTUs (Remote Terminal Units)
‚Ä¢ PLCs (Programmable Logic Controllers)
‚Ä¢ Communication protocols (Modbus, DNP3, etc.)

Want to learn more about any of these?
scada.modbus:
**Modbus Protocol** üì°

Modbus is a serial communication protocol developed in 1979 for PLCs.

**Key Concepts:**
‚Ä¢ **Master-Slave**: One master, multiple slaves
‚Ä¢ **Registers**: Hold data (16-bit values)
‚Ä¢ **Coils**: Digital outputs (ON/OFF)
‚Ä¢ **Function Codes**: Commands (read, write, etc.)

**In our lab:**
‚Ä¢ Registers 0-9: Holding registers
‚Ä¢ Coils 0-7: Digital outputs
‚Ä¢ Port 502: Standard Modbus TCP port

Try reading a register or toggling a coil!

scada.security:
**SCADA Security Concerns:** üîí

‚Ä¢ **No authentication**: Modbus has no built-in security
‚Ä¢ **Plain text**: Data sent unencrypted
‚Ä¢ **Broadcast**: Anyone on network can read/write
‚Ä¢ **Legacy systems**: Often can't be patched

**Best Practices:**
‚úì Network segmentation
‚úì Firewall rules
‚úì IDS/IPS monitoring
‚úì Secure VPN access

In the Pentest lab, you'll see these vulnerabilities firsthand!

‚Ä¢ No encryption

**HTTP/HTTPS** (Ports 80/443)

‚Ä¢ REST APIs
‚Ä¢ Configuration interfaces

**ICMP**

‚Ä¢ Network diagnostics

**In the lab:**

concepts.ot_vs_it:
**OT vs IT Security** üè≠ vs üíª

**IT (Information Technology):**
‚Ä¢ Confidentiality first
‚Ä¢ Can tolerate downtime
‚Ä¢ Regular patching
‚Ä¢ Modern systems

**OT (Operational Technology):**
‚Ä¢ Availability first
‚Ä¢ Zero downtime tolerance
‚Ä¢ Legacy systems
‚Ä¢ Safety-critical

**Key Differences:**
‚Ä¢ OT prioritizes safety and availability
‚Ä¢ IT prioritizes confidentiality
‚Ä¢ OT has longer lifecycles (20+ years)
‚Ä¢ IT updates frequently

This is why OT security is unique!
